public class Base64Encoder
extends PSSimpleJavaUdfExtension

This class implements the UDF processor interface so it can be used as a Rhythmyx function. See processUdf for a description.

Method Detail

processUdf

public Object processUdf(Object[] params,
                         IPSRequestContext request)
                  throws PSConversionException
The Base64Encoder class is used to encode data from the normal format.

Base64 Encoding is defined in RFC 1521 .

This class can be used to store encoded passwords. For example, when we register a site for publishing or a remote publisher, we want to store the FTP password and CMS passwords in the database in encoded format to avoid people seeing the plain text passwords. Use this UDF to base64 encrypt the passwords that are posted in an HTML form.

Specified by:
processUdf in interface IPSUdfProcessor
Parameters:
params - An array containing exactly 1 or 2 elements the first of which contains the object that contains the normal text. A toString will be called against this object. If null, null is returned. If empty, the emtpy string is returned. If the second parameter is supplied and is not null or the empty string, then this parameter will be used to determine how the bytes from the encoded first argument are interpreted when creating the string which is returned (this will be used as the character encoding).
request - The current request context.
Returns:
The URL created from the supplied base, parameters and values.
Throws:
PSConversionException - If the base name is empty or null .
